ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Neuro-maturational lag
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initial central auditory deficits spontaneously improved to near-normal levels over 3 years, correlating with academic gains, despite lack of consistent rehabilitation.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Central Auditory Processing Disorder (CAPD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initial testing showed significant deficits in temporal patterning and dichotic listening, though the subsequent improvement suggests a maturational delay rather than a static disorder.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To evaluate central auditory processing abilities given the history of listening difficulties and learning disability.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Peripheral hearing was normal. Central auditory evaluation revealed significant deficits, particularly in temporal patterning (severe bilateral deficits) and dichotic listening (moderate left ear deficits), consistent with a central auditory processing disorder affecting interhemispheric transfer and temporal processing.

tests.name: Central Auditory Test Battery
tests.result_summary: Severe bilateral deficits on Frequency Patterns (~10-15%). Moderate left ear deficits on Dichotic Digits (~45%) and Competing Sentences (~35%). Mild right ear deficit and borderline normal left ear on SSW (~60%).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Re-evaluation after 3 years showed spontaneous improvement to essentially normal levels on most central tests, with only a mild residual deficit in frequency patterns. This profile is consistent with neuro-maturational lag.

tests.name: Central Auditory Test Battery
tests.result_summary: Improvement to essentially normal levels on Competing Sentences (>90%), Dichotic Digits (>90%), and SSW (>85%). Frequency Patterns improved but showed a residual mild deficit (LE ~40%, RE ~65%).

proposed_items: Auditory rehabilitation program (initiated but not continued)
counseling_actions: Explain the concept of neuro-maturational lag as the likely cause of initial deficits and subsequent improvement
Discuss residual difficulties with background noise and distractibility

escalation.rationale_short: Patient has shown significant improvement; routine monitoring of residual academic and listening issues is appropriate.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor for any changes in academic performance or listening difficulties.

expected_outcome: Central Auditory Test Battery (Follow-up): Improvement to essentially normal levels on all tests except Frequency Patterns, where a mild deficit remained.
Marked academic improvements over the past 3 years, reading only one grade level below expectations.
Improved ability to follow auditory directions.
Persistent difficulties with background noise and distractibility.
